subject: Programming
title: Machine Code and Binary
description: One-minute skill: Machine Code and Binary.

hook.text: Every app, game, and website ultimately becomes a stream of ones and zeros.

buildup.text: Machine code is the only language a CPU truly understands. Everything else is translation.

discovery.text: Early programmers toggled physical switches to enter binary instructions one bit at a time.

twist.text: A single flipped bit could crash an entire program. There was no undo button.

climax.text: Machine code forced perfect precision. One mistake meant starting over from scratch.

punchline.text: Computers only speak ones and zeros.

quiz.question: How did early programmers enter machine code?
